data.title: Decent meal - but my colleague from India loved it
data.text: I am not a fan of Indian or spicy foods but came here as my colleague  from India is vegetarian and I wanted to offer her more options than pasta and salads during her 3 week business trip to the US. Food was ok for me but my colleague enjoyed it very much. Service was very good and didn't make us feel rushed although we arrived 45 minutes to closing. Restaurant was very clean. If I was into spicy foods I would probably rate higher.

data.title: Disappointed - went expecting authentic Indian Food
data.text: Went with great expectations, but was disappointed. Food preparation was far from authentic Indian (may be targeting only American tastebuds). Go to this place, only if you are mostly seeking non-spicy food.

data.title: Mouth-watering!!!
data.text: As the name suggests. the food here is really great!!! I traveled to Colorado for business last year and found this place pretty close to the hotel where I was staying. Hence, I would go once in a fortnight. Even though there are few other Indian restaurants in the area, but none could match the taste of Zaika. The food is great and the service is great too. They have good selection in the Lunch buffet which is priced competitively. Try the goat biriyani - its too good. Would love to go back again.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Food was good, as in Broom Field we have very less Indian option, so I liked the food in Zaika, but the menu is very limited.

data.title: Great food great experience!
data.text: Greeted so pleasantly and served so quickly. Our server was kind enough to give suggestions. I chose the Tandoori salmon was divine and the Channa still makes our mouth water just talking about it!

data.title: Great flavors with some unique dishes
data.text: We live near this restaurant and go every 2-3 weeks because it's probably the best Indian food in the Denver area and the service is always fast and friendly.  The spices and flavors are always very fresh and delicious.  They have some menu items that you don't see every where else.

data.title: Quality across the board.
data.text:
I visited this restaurant about 3 hours ago to introduce my girlfriend to Indian cuisine and give their lunch buffet a try on the only day I have time.

The only thing that could be equated as a negative would be the amount of options. There were 5 vegetarian and 3 chicken options. I won't even bother going through the list because they were all FANTASTIC.

The chicken was tender, the vegetables were well seasoned and cooked perfectly, the chutneys were fabulous, the Naan was delicious with their cucumber mint yogurt.

The 11$ price tag on some of the best Indian food I've had in years would be enough to get me to come back, but there's more.

The wait staff was insanely courteous and quick to refill water, take plates, and check in only when felt necessary. The atmosphere is pleasant and extremly clean with the music set at a volume allowing conversation, but still setting an ambience.

If you're reading this trying to decide where to go to eat, you've already found it.
Enjoy.

data.title: Great Food and Superior Service
data.text: Zaika is some of the best Indian food I have had.  The lunch buffet is fast and excellent.  I highly recommend this place.  I hope it stays as consistent and good as it have been for the past 6 months!

data.title: Yummy food, awesome gluten free options
data.text: Met a friend for dinner and we were not disappointed. They have all of the classic dishes that you think of when you think Indian food, but the menu is expanded beyond that as well. I had the lamb kabob (boti kabob) and it was awesome. It came with a yummy spicy yogurt sauce on the side but the lamb itself was wonderfully spiced without the sauce. I ate all of it. Lots of gluten free options and some dairy free as well, clearly marked which I really appreciate as someone with food allergies.  Very nice staff.

data.title: Weekly buffet escape
data.text: After moving from the East coast and some fantastic metro NYC Indian restaurants, we tried many different Indian lunch buffets in the Broomfield area, however, it wasn't until we found Zaika, that we knew we didn't miss the East coast anymore.  Chicken Tikka was what got us in the door, but the delicious options on the buffet have expanded my horizons and it doesn't matter what they put out now, I'm craving it at least once a week.

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: One of the cooks from azitra is cooking at zaika. Still great quality. We were pleasantly surprised at the buffet. It is always fresh. We have been back many times

data.title: worth a try
data.text: For me, Indian food is hit or miss. Either it's really good or really bad. And after reading all the positive reviews about this place I decided to try it.  I had the mixed grill. The food was good and flavorful. I'm glad the waiter asked me what level of spice I would like on the food because the level I picked was perfect! The only thing was the portion was a little smaller than what I was expecting.

data.title: Excellent food, superb service, nice ambience, you will want to go back
data.text:
We have never eaten Indian food before but my son had a homework assignment to try new cuisines, so we had dinner at Zaika.  The restaurant is beautiful inside - far more inviting than the outside building.  The service here is superb.  And we loved the food.
I believe the owner Bobby seated us and was our primary server.  He had a friendly approach and truly wanted us to enjoy our evening.  It made for a relaxing experience.  
For appetizers, we enjoyed the MoMo dumplings and the Kebab Sampler Platter.  Both very good and the sauces that came with it were all good.  In fact, the sauces at this restaurant are the real shining stars.  They create some really flavorful sauces.  
For dinner we enjoyed Lamb Vindaloo which he warned us was very spicy.  My husband loves spicy so he really enjoyed it, but it's not for someone who doesn't like the hot.  My son loved the Chicken Tikka Masala, which Bobby said was one of the most popular dishes.  And I really loved my Chicken Dhaniya with a cashew based sauce.  We also had 2 orders of garlic naan.
In a nutshell, if you are looking for a pleasant evening with superb service in a relaxed atmosphere while enjoying fresh, flavorful food, Zaika is an excellent choice.

data.title: Best Indian lunch buffet we've been to in the Front Range
data.text: The title says it all, really fresh selections, not the goopy starchy mess which you'll find at other unmentionable institutions.     My wife and I were really impressed, especially since there are great selections for those on a low carb diet.    Very friendly service was a plus.

data.title: Zaika...true to its meaning (sense of taste)
data.text: We have been to Zaika few times since we know the owner from his previous restaurant. The food is good, service is attentive but location may not be well suited for this good restaurant. They have good spread for lunch buffet and some of the dishes are unique (you may not find it in other Indian restaurant).

data.title: Best Indian Buffet
data.text: Outside is non-descript, but inside is fine dining at its best. We went for lunch and were seated at a table with linen napkins and heavy silverware cutlery.  Immediately we were served.  The dishes on the buffet change daily. On the day we went, we were greeted with Fish Curry, a Chicken Curry, Curried Potatoes, and Lamb Curry.  All were deliciously spicy and tasty.  The Tandoori Chicken was wonderful.  They brought fresh naan to the table frequently.  I am an Indian, and ai do not like eating at Indian a restaurants because the curry flavor changes.  I loved this place!

data.title: Great food - not very good service
data.text: It was pretty good Indian food. I've had better...But as always, the portions are big and the flavors are deep. The service was pretty bad unfortunately. They were nice, but understaffed. One waiter on a Friday night - technically, there were 2, but the other one seemed a bit lost on what to do, maybe she was new...I would still recommend going. If you have never had Indian food, this would be a good place to start --> they don't serve all of the basics, but a good spread. If you are a vegetarian, any indian restaurant will satisfy you! They always have a huge vegetarian selection.

data.title: Five stars all the way!
data.text: We were looking for a place to meet our son and his wife for dinner.  Craving Indian food I searched on Trip Advisor and was led to Zaika that already had many very positive reviews.  We made a reservation early in the afternoon although arrive at 5:30 it wasn't necessary (always good to be sure though!).  We received a very genuine greeting.  There is an elephant statue in a small pond with stones, seashells, and koi--very pretty! We were seated at a a glossy, black table near a window.  Granted they weren't busy yet at that early hour, but the servers were very attentive and I felt that they were that way even if they were busy.  Our waiter was ready to answer any questions that we had about the menu including levels of spice from 1-5.  We each ordered our own meal and there was enough to share and sample.  We really enjoyed the garlic naan.  I could have made a meal on that alone! I chose the shrimp masala with a side order of marinated mushrooms which were wonderful!  The portions were large and we all took a little bit home to enjoy another day.  There are no Indian restaurants in our city but I would definitely drive to Broomfield to visit Zaika again.  Very easy to find and plenty of parking!

data.title: A staple in our lunch rotation
data.text: This is the third Indian restaurant at this location in as many years, but the first worth eating at. Love the chai.

data.title: Fantastic food and service
data.text: Loved the food and drinks here. Generous portions and quick service. The staff was really nice and attentive.
